verbose_text: CD10 is one of the markers often used in the diagnostic workup of follicular lymphomas in humans.42 In follicular lymphoma, CD10 expression is often strong within follicular structures, but may be decreased or absent in the interfollicular neoplastic B cells.43 CD10 immunohistochemistry was pursued in this case because of the follicular pattern and the few remaining normal follicles were positive for CD10, but the vast majority of B cells in this neoplasm were negative for CD10.
